Meeting held on 10.01.2019 (Agenda item No 134.01) observed that the States are the major beneficiaries on account of road development project in the form of increase in land value, etc. Therefore, the States should share the cost of land acquisition and may raise resources by monetization of land value_ Subsequently, the Authority in its 140th Meeting held on 20.06.2019 (Agenda item No 140.06) decided that MoU should be explored with State Governments for monetization of roadside land/sharing of development fee due to increased land values along developed NH: The projects should be taken up in only those States which sign the MoU. 2 In accordance with the above direction of the Board, Member (F) made a presentation on monetisation of roadside land, before the Authority in its   141st Meeting held on 30.07.2019. The following methodology was proposed: In identified projects, 50%   of Land Acquisition Cost  should be deposited upfront by the State Govt into an Escrow Account and then balance 50% would be deposited by NHAI: (ii) State Govt. may explore any of the following options for land monetisation in an influence are of 500 m on either side of the Project Highway and deposit these revenues into the Escrow Account till NHAI's share of LA cost is recovered: (a) Development charges taken for granting of building permissions in the influence area by local planning authority/ municipal bodies (b) State Government to levy 1% Transfer Tax or any similar tax on the total value of land transaction in the influence area. (c) State Government/ Urban Local Bodies may charge premium on Sale of additional Floor Area Ratio/ Floor Space Index   (FARIFSI) within the influence zone 3 The decision of the Authority on the above proposal (Agenda Item No 141.13) is as under: 41 RTMI MI NHAL 134th
